column1: On [[28 July]] [[1955]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column2: a letter]] to Jennifer Brookes-Smith''' (name also given as "Jennifer Paxman").<ref name=TB/><ref name=CG>{{CG

column1: *'''Subject(s):''' Replying to a letter written in March, Tolkien apologises for having been busy.<ref name=CG/> Among the subjects Tolkien discusses in the letter are the production of the Appendices and map for ''[[The Return of the King]]'' and an impending trip to [[Gondor]]: [[Pelargir]] and [[Lossarnach]] - identified as Italy: Venice and Assisi.<ref name=TB>{{webcite
*'''Publication:''' A description of the letter appeared in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
column2: The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''. Extracts from the letter were reproduced in ''[[Christie's 20th Century Books and Manuscripts 2 December 2003]]''.
